dfischer.proxysniffer

Class RecorderBlacklistConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.proxysniffer.RecorderBlacklistConfig

  • public class RecorderBlacklistConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    DNS-Name and IP address Blacklist configuration for the proxy recorder. The configuration is an ASCII file that contains on each line a DNS-Name or an IP address, followed by a blacklist action (separated by a white space). The wildcard '*' is also supported as part of a DNS-Name or an IP address. The following blacklist action are supported
    • abort : abort the network connection to the web client
    • <status-code-number>> : send a response with the corresponding HTTP status code (w/o content data)
    • webbugimage : send as response a 1x1 transparent image with a 200 OK status code
    Lines that are stating with a # hash char are not considered (commented out).
    Note: in case of any match to a DNS-Name or an IP address the web client request will also not be recorded.
    See Also:
    RecorderWhitelistConfig, RecorderURLBlacklistConfig, RecorderURLWhitelistConfig, RecorderURLRegexBlacklistConfig, RecorderURLRegexWhitelistConfig

      • getBlacklistAction

        public RecorderBlacklistAction getBlacklistAction(java.lang.String dnsOrIP)
        Check if a DNS name or an IP address match to the blacklist.
        Parameters:
        dnsOrIP - DNS name or an IP address to check
        Returns:
        result of blacklist check
        See Also:
        RecorderBlacklistAction.BLACKLIST_ACTION_NIL, RecorderBlacklistAction.BLACKLIST_ACTION_ABORT, RecorderBlacklistAction.BLACKLIST_ACTION_HTTP_CODE, RecorderBlacklistAction.BLACKLIST_ACTION_WEBBUGIMAGE

      • readFromFile

        public void readFromFile(java.io.File f)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Read the blacklist configuration from a file. Note: no error is thrown if the file does not exists - in such a case the blacklist configuration will be cleared (empty).
        Parameters:
        f - the file that contains the blacklist configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
